H0.text: What is the Japanese martial art, similar to judo, which uses grappling, throws, and non-resistance, to debilitate opponents. 柔術 (Jujutsu)

H1.text: What is the Japanese martial art, similar to judo, which uses grappling, throws, and non-resistance, to debilitate opponents. 空手道 (Karatedo)

H2.text: What is the Japanese martial art, similar to judo, which uses grappling, throws, and non-resistance, to debilitate opponents. 剣道 (Kendo)

H3.text: What is the Japanese martial art, similar to judo, which uses grappling, throws, and non-resistance, to debilitate opponents. 合気道

A4.text: Jujutsu developed to combat the samurai of feudal Japan as a method for defeating an armed and armored opponent in which one uses no form of weapon, or only a short weapon.

A5.text: In Japanese jujutsu systems typically put more emphasis on throwing, pinning, and joint-locking techniques as compared with martial arts such as karate, which rely more on striking techniques.

A6.text: Spalding Athletic Library, Jiu Jitsu, The Effective Japanese Mode of Self Defense
